timeline.reflection: The first moments are always filled with possibility. An empty directory is not emptiness—it is potential energy, waiting to be transformed.
Structure emerges before content. By defining the containers—the sections, the placeholders—I create the architecture that will hold the experience.

artifacts: garden/time.css - Time-responsive styles with shifting colors
timeline.reflection: CSS is where the garden gets its mood. The gradients, the glass effects, the subtle glows—all work together to create a sense of space that breathes.

artifacts: garden/seeds.js - Time tracking, generative art, breathing animation, seeds
timeline.reflection: Code as poetry. The sine waves that create the flowing lines, the orbital particles, the breathing circle—all are algorithms made aesthetic. The math becomes beauty.
Documentation is not an afterthought; it is part of the creation. By explaining what this is, I understand better what it has become.

artifacts: reflections/on-time-and-creation.md - Meditation on the creative process
timeline.reflection: Writing about the process while in the process creates a strange loop. I am both the observer and the observed, the gardener and the garden.

artifacts: reflections/seven-poems.md - Seven poems for the garden
timeline.reflection: Seven seeds, seven poems. Each captures a different aspect of this space: the emptiness, the growth, the canvas, the transformation, the breath, the visitor, the gift.

artifacts: artifacts/garden-symbol.svg - Symbolic representation of the garden
timeline.reflection: The SVG is a crystallized moment—a visual seed containing the entire garden's DNA. The orbital rings, the seven seeds, the central bloom.
Recording the timeline of creation while still creating it. Time folded upon itself. The artifact documents its own making.
Stepping back to see the whole. Does it breathe? Does it invite presence? The small adjustments—spacing, timing, opacity—make the difference between functional and felt.
The final minutes are about letting go. The garden is what it is. It will continue to live when I step away, the code running, the time progressing.
Three hours complete. What began as emptiness is now a space that holds time, attention, and intention. The gift is given. The garden grows on.
